label: Mark of the Sealed Ones
description: A faint image of an underwater landscape shimmers inside the ancient jewel. While the Ancient Hearth is being corrupted, resources sacrificed within it burn 50% longer.

label: Blightrot Pruner
description: Blightrot spores aren't technically eggs, but they taste the same. You gain 5 <sprite name="[food raw] eggs"> Eggs when a Blightrot Cyst appears in your settlement.

label: Grim Fate
description: The forest will claim a villager's life during each storm (multiplied by the number of years that have passed).

label: Recultivation
description: If only Rainpunk Cauldrons didn't go haywire so often, they could be used to revolutionize agriculture. Spawns 10 to 14 fields of fertile soil nearby.

label: From the Shadows
description: Confused, empty-eyed creatures emerge from the Hearth. Every time Voice of the Sealed Ones triggers after the Hearth reaches 100% Corruption, 3 new villagers appear in the settlement.

label: Land of Greed
description: The strange totem causes you to only focus on your wealth... And the Crown is worried. Impatience grows 50% quicker, but every ongoing trade route reduces the Impatience generation speed by –20%.

label: The Queen's People
description: For the Queen, nothing is more important than her people. Losing villagers will add 0.5 more points to her Impatience.

label: Blood Price Contract
description: A shady, but lucrative deal. Gain 10 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber every time a villager dies or leaves.

label: Over-Diligent Woodworkers (Stormforged)
description: Some woodworkers just can't stop working. Gain 5 <sprite name="[vessel] barrels"> Barrels for every 5 <sprite name="[mat processed] planks"> Planks produced.

label: Small Press (Stormforged)
description: A useful mill upgrade. Gain 5 <sprite name="[crafting] oil"> Oil for every 10 <sprite name="[crafting] flour"> Flour produced.

label: Dye Extractor (Stormforged)
description: Gain 10 <sprite name="[crafting] dye"> Dye for every 10 <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects produced. +1 to <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects production. Gain an additional <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects every yield (from gathering, farming, fishing, or production).

label: Alarm Bells (Stormforged)
description: The Brass Order's newest invention. All workers have a +10% higher chance of producing double yields for every 100 points of expected corruption per minute in the Ancient Hearth.

label: Deep Pockets (Stormforged)
description: Receive 15 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber for every 3 completed trade routes.

label: Survivor Bonding (Stormforged)
description: The people in your settlement have survived many hardships, bringing them closer together (+25% villager speed, 3 Global Resolve).

label: Back to Nature (Stormforged)
description: An old, forbidden ritual. Gain +150% more yield in all buildings that use fertile soil.

label: Vineyard Town (Stormforged)
description: The settlement specializes in wine production. Gain +1 to Beaver Resolve for every 50 <sprite name="[needs] wine"> Wine produced.

label: Blood Price Contract (Stormforged)
description: A shady, but lucrative deal. Gain 20 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber and 1 <sprite name="[valuable] ancient tablet"> Ancient Tablet every time a villager dies or leaves.

label: Cannibalism (Stormforged)
description: Gain 40 <sprite name="[food raw] meat"> Meat and 20 <sprite name="[food processed] jerky"> Jerky every time a villager dies or leaves.

label: Cheap Construction (Stormforged)
description: All buildings cost 50% less.

label: Copper Extractor (Stormforged)
description: Machinery specialized in extracting copper from petrified trees. Gain 1 <sprite name="[metal] copper bar"> Copper Bars for every 15 <sprite name="[mat raw] wood"> Wood produced.

label: Forsaken Seal (Stormforged)
description: An artifact of the Forsaken Gods. Gain one cornerstone reroll charge at the beginning of each storm.

label: Leftover Crops (Stormforged)
description: Gain 1 <sprite name="[packs] pack of crops"> Pack of Crops and 1 <sprite name="[packs] pack of provisions"> Pack of Provisions for every 12 <sprite name="[food raw] herbs"> Herbs produced.

label: Old Fedora Hat (Stormforged)
description: An old inscription on the bottom of the hat says: "Fortune and glory". Increases the chance of doubling event loot by 75% (this doesn't apply to perks and blueprints).

label: Forge Trip Hammer (Stormforged)
description: Powerful and precise machinery. <sprite name="[mat processed] parts"> Parts (<sprite name=grade3>) can be produced in the Smithy and +100% to amount of goods produced in the Smithy.

label: Advanced Fuel (Stormforged)
description: All fuel recipes are +50% faster and produce +33% more goods.

label: Secret Techniques of the Firekeeper (Stormforged)
description: An old manuscript detailing long-forgotten burning rites. Fuel consumption in Hearths is decreased by 33%. Resources you sacrifice in the Ancient Hearth burn for 25% longer.

label: Tea Specialization (Stormforged)
description: The settlement specializes in cosmetic production. Gain +1 to Harpy Resolve for every 50 <sprite name="[needs] tea"> Tea produced.

label: Spices (Stormforged)
description: <sprite name="[food raw] herbs"> Herb and <sprite name="[food raw] roots"> Root production is increased by +1 for every 50 <sprite name="[food processed] biscuits"> Biscuits produced.

label: Hidden from the Queen (Stormforged)
description: The crown doesn't need to know everything. Impatience doesn't grow when villagers leave or die.

label: Crowded Houses (Stormforged)
description: All houses have room for 1 more villager, and the time between breaks for workers increases by +25%.

label: Queen's Gift (Stormforged)
description: A mysterious amber orb with a magical flame trapped within. Increases the Ancient Hearth's resistance by 250 for every woodcutter in your settlement.

label: Generous Gifts (Stormforged)
description: Wealthy settlements attract wealthy settlers. Newcomers bring 75% more goods with them for every Hearth level gained.

label: Religious Settlement (Stormforged)
description: The settlement specializes in incense production. Gain +1 to Human Resolve for every 50 <sprite name="[needs] incense"> Incense produced.

label: Hunter-Gatherers (Stormforged)
description: All camp production is increased by 100%. Bonus does not affect the Woodcutters' Camp.

label: Woodpecker Technique (Stormforged)
description: Gain 5 <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects every time woodcutters cut down a tree during the Storm.

label: Ancient Pact (Stormforged)
description: You can see the content of undiscovered glades.

label: Flame Amulets (Stormforged)
description: An artifact infused with the power of the Holy Flame. Hostility from woodcutters is decreased by 8. Woodcutters have a +20% chance of producing twice the normal yield.

label: Training Grounds (Stormforged)
description: The settlement specializes in training gear production. Gain +1 to Lizard Resolve for every 50 <sprite name="[needs] training gear"> Training Gear produced.

label: Ancient Stabilizer (Stormforged)
description: A strange relic that fits into the Hearth. +1 to <sprite name="[mat raw] wood"> Wood production. Fuel consumption in Hearths is decreased by 20%.

label: Firelink Ritual (Stormforged)
description: There is nothing the forest hates more than fire. Every villager with their need for religion fulfilled decreases the forest’s Hostility by 10.

label: Metallurgic Proficiency (Stormforged)
description: Increases the production speed of Copper Bars, Crystalized Dew, and all recipes that use metal ingots by 66%.+1 to <sprite name="[metal] copper bar"> copper bar and <sprite name="[metal] crystalized dew"> crystalized dew production.

label: Mist Piercers (Stormforged)
description: You can see the content of undiscovered glades.

label: Moldy Grain Seeds (Stormforged)
description: A new type of grain. Gain 8 <sprite name="[food raw] mushrooms"> Mushrooms for every 10 <sprite name="[food raw] grain"> Grain produced.

label: Trade Negotiations (Stormforged)
description: Trade routes are worth 3 more <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber. Doesn't apply to routes already in progress. This effect scales along with the quantity of goods exported.

label: Mushroom Seedlings (Stormforged)
description: All farms can plant <sprite name="[food raw] mushrooms"> mushrooms (<sprite name=grade3>) on farm fields during drizzle season.

label: Crowded Caravan (Stormforged)
description: Each newcomer group has 3 additional villagers. New villagers bring 50% more goods with them.

label: Overexploitation (Stormforged)
description: Newly discovered resource nodes have more charges: +20 for small deposits, and +50 for large deposits.

label: Export Specialization (Stormforged)
description: Gain +2 to production yields for all packs of goods. All packs of goods are produced 50% faster.

label: Export Contract (Stormforged)
description: Increases the production yield of packs of goods by +100%. Gain 2 additional active trade route slots.

label: Free Samples (Stormforged)
description: Gain 2 <sprite name="[mat processed] parts"> Parts every time you sell goods worth 15 Amber.

label: Firekeeper's Prayer (Stormforged)
description: Glade event work speed increased by 30%. Resources you sacrifice in the Ancient Hearth burn for 30% longer.

label: Generous Rations (Stormforged)
description: Global Resolve is increased by 5, and villagers have a +10% chance of not consuming food during a break.

label: Rebellious Spirit (Stormforged)
description: The people are feeling oddly rebellious. Gain +1 Global Resolve for every 1 Impatience Point.

label: Stormwalker Training (Stormforged)
description: Your villagers learn how to travel the wilderness from the very best - the Royal Stormwalkers. Trade route caravans travel faster by 40%. Traders will arrive 33% quicker.

label: Force of Nature (Stormforged)
description: The forest and the everlasting rain are connected somehow. Gain +5 to Storm Water production for every 2 Woodcutters in your settlement. Increases the tank capacity for every type of rainwater by +100 (one time only).

label: Hidden Reward (Stormforged)
description: Gain 1 <sprite name="[valuable] ancient tablet"> Ancient Tablet for every 1 completed Glade Event. (the bonus is added retroactively)

label: Bone Tools (Stormforged)
description: Gain 6 <sprite name="[tools] simple tools"> Tools every time a villager leaves or dies.

label: Tightened Belt (Stormforged)
description: Travel cost on trade routes is reduced by 3. Doesn't apply to routes already in progress. This effect scales along with the quantity of goods exported.

label: Urban Planning (Stormforged)
description: For every 6 completed trade routes, all houses will have room for one more person.

label: Trade Logs (Stormforged)
description: Detailed notes on different traders and their wares. Gain 2 additional active trade route slots. Traders will arrive +33% quicker and have +1 more cornerstones on sale.

label: Lost in the Wilds (Stormforged)
description: Gain one villager every time you discover a new glade. Villagers add less Hostility (-1).

label: No Quality Control (Stormforged)
description: Gain +2 to wood production. After each storm, all stored wood is removed, and you get 150 <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects in return.

label: Prayer Book (Stormforged)
description: Scouts work 20% faster on Glade Events for every firekeeper assigned to a Hearth.

label: Effective Parasite
description: The Blightrot feeds on the tree's valuable nutrients, making new cysts much more resilient. Cysts burn for 5 seconds longer.

label: Absorption
description: Blightrot Cysts consume the storm's energy and become more resilient. Burning cysts takes 5 seconds longer.

label: Baptism of Fire
description: While the Hearth is corrupted, you’re unable to sacrifice resources.

label: Plague of Darkness
description: >Missing key<

label: Ritual of Denial
description: Fishmen hate fire, and will do anything in their power to extinguish every last flame in the world. Blocks the ability to sacrifice goods in the Hearth. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Cursed Rain
description: It's no use making sacrifices during the storm here.

label: Effect_PortBlueprintFromCategoryPick_Name
description: Effect_PortBlueprintFromCategoryPick_Desc

label: Firekeeper's Armor
description: Allows firekeepers to combat corruption more efficiently. Every burned cyst removes an additional 50 corruption.

label: TODO NAME
description: TODO DESC 1

label: Malcontents
description: You took a very peculiar group of settlers with you. They seem perpetually dissatisfied. The Resolve threshold at which each species starts producing Reputation increases by 1 more point for every Reputation Point they generate.

label: Frosts
description: A bizarre cold rises from below and engulfs the Sacred Flame. Reduces the radius of Hearths by -3 fields.

label: No contact
description: Harsh weather conditions make it impossible to reach the Citadel. Gaining Reputation doesn't lower Impatience.

label: Higher Expectations
description: The Queen expects a lot from a viceroy of your rank. Impatience falls by 0.5 points less for every Reputation Point you gain.

label: Politically Outmaneuvered
description: Your rivals in the court are making sure all your deeds are discredited. Impatience falls by 0.5 points less for every Reputation Point you gain.

label: Unearthly Element
description: The firekeeper's power weakens in the face of an otherworldly force. The maximum number of sacrifice stacks in the Ancient Hearth is lowered by 1.

label: Forsaken Altar
description: Can collect rainwater used for crafting and powering Rain Engines in production buildings. The type of collected rainwater depends on the season. Has a tank capacity of 100.

label: Alchemist's Hut
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[metal] crystalized dew> Crystalized Dew (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[needs] tea> Tea (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[needs] wine> Wine (<sprite name=grade2>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] clearance water"> Clearance Water.

label: Forsaken Altar
description: An ancient altar to the Forsaken Gods. In the midst of the raging storm, you can make sacrifices here to gain unimaginable powers.

label: Scribe
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[needs] scrolls> Scrolls (<sprite name=grade3>), <sprite name=[packs] pack of trade goods> Pack of Trade Goods (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[needs] ale> Ale (<sprite name=grade1>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] clearance water"> Clearance Water.

label: Beacon Tower
description: A powerful, ancient structure that allows you to summon aid directly from the Citadel. Grants access to three types of temporary support abilities.

label: Clothier
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[needs] coats> Coats (<sprite name=grade3>), <sprite name=[packs] pack of building materials> Pack of Building Materials (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[vessel] waterskin> Waterskins (<sprite name=grade1>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] clearance water"> Clearance Water.

label: Small Farm
description: Uses nearby farm fields to grow  <sprite name=[food raw] vegetables> Vegetables (<sprite name=grade1>), <sprite name=[food raw] grain> Grain (<sprite name=grade2>).

label: Smelter
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[metal] copper bar> Copper Bars (<sprite name=grade3>), <sprite name=[needs] training gear> Training Gear (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[food processed] pie> Pie (<sprite name=grade1>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] storm water"> Storm Water.

label: Smithy
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[tools] simple tools> Tools (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[mat processed] pipe> Pipes (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[packs] pack of trade goods> Pack of Trade Goods (<sprite name=grade2>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] storm water"> Storm Water.

label: Smokehouse
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[food processed] jerky> Jerky (<sprite name=grade3>), <sprite name=[vessel] pottery> Pottery (<sprite name=grade1>), <sprite name=[needs] incense> Incense (<sprite name=grade1>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] drizzle water"> Drizzle Water.

label: Stamping Mill
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[mat processed] bricks> Bricks (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[crafting] flour> Flour (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[metal] copper bar> Copper Bars (<sprite name=grade2>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] clearance water"> Clearance Water.

label: Supplier
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[crafting] flour> Flour (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[mat processed] planks> Planks (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[vessel] waterskin> Waterskins (<sprite name=grade2>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] clearance water"> Clearance Water.

label: Tavern
description: A place where villagers can fulfill their need for: Leisure,  Luxury. Passive effects: Gleeman's Tales.

label: Apothecary
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[needs] tea> Tea (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[food processed] porridge> Porridge (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[food processed] jerky> Jerky (<sprite name=grade2>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] drizzle water"> Drizzle Water.

label: Temple
description: A place where villagers can fulfill their need for: Religion,  Education. Passive effects: Sacrament of the Flame.

label: Tinctury
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[crafting] dye> Dye (<sprite name=grade3>), <sprite name=[needs] ale> Ale (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[needs] wine> Wine (<sprite name=grade1>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] drizzle water"> Drizzle Water.

label: Tinkerer
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[tools] simple tools> Tools (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[needs] training gear> Training Gear (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[vessel] pottery> Pottery (<sprite name=grade2>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] storm water"> Storm Water.

label: Toolshop
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[tools] simple tools> Tools (<sprite name=grade3>), <sprite name=[mat processed] pipe> Pipes (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[needs] boots> Boots (<sprite name=grade2>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] storm water"> Storm Water.

label: Trappers' Camp
description: An advanced camp. Can gather large and giant resource nodes in addition to small ones. Can collect:  <sprite name=[food raw] meat> Meat (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[food raw] insects> Insects (<sprite name=grade2>), <sprite name=[food raw] eggs> Eggs (<sprite name=grade2>).

label: Weaver
description:
Can produce:  <sprite name=[mat processed] fabric> Fabric (<sprite name=grade3>), <sprite name=[needs] boots> Boots (<sprite name=grade1>), <sprite name=[needs] training gear> Training Gear (<sprite name=grade1>). 
Can use: <sprite name="[water] clearance water"> Clearance Water.

label: Royal Archaeologists
description: Every viceroy embarking on an expedition to the Scarlet Orchard is assigned a royal archaeologist. You gain access to a new essential building: Archaeologist's Office.

label: Strider Port
description: Your settlement begins on the coast of this strange land, near an ancient Strider Port. Use it to send out expeditions in search of blueprints and treasure. However, you will receive fewer blueprints from Reputation.

label: Dual Carriage System
description: Two rainpunk hauling carts will be assigned to the Main Warehouse to help transport resources between buildings.

label: Hauling Cart
description: An automated rainpunk cart will be assigned to every warehouse in the settlement to help transport resources between buildings.

label: Exposed Resources
description: The ground is soft, and soaked with the rain's essence. Mines produce 50% more goods during drizzle season.

label: Rotting Wood
description: The rain is causing the trees to rot and fall apart. Woodcutters fell trees 50% faster, but have a +100% chance of destroying their yield.

label: Intensive Mutations
description: Living organisms in this region are mutated, and much larger than in other places. Doubles the amount of secondary resources gathered from trees.

label: Reinforced Tools
description: +100% to amount of goods produced in the Hallowed Small Farm.

label: Reinforced Tools
description: +100% to amount of goods produced in the Small Farm.

label: Reinforced Tools

label: Woodcutter's Tools

label: Reinforced Tools
description: +50% to amount of goods produced in the Woodcutters' Camp.

label: Orderly Storage
description: All buildings have their storage capacity increased by 10.

label: Lightning Strike
description: Some scholars are trying to capture and harness the power of lightning... but their experiments usually bring destruction instead. Lightning will turn 4 buildings into ruins.

label: Collapse
description: If you don't deliver the required goods, 3 buildings will turn into ruins.

label: Plague of Thunderstorms
description: Sinister storm clouds are approaching relentlessly, with bolts of lightning lacerating the sky. Lightning will turn 3 buildings into ruins.

label: Corrosive Torrent
description: The rain is especially toxic in this region. No resources will be refunded after destroying a building.

label: Insatiable Hunger
description: Working in this environment requires a lot of energy. Villagers have a higher chance of consuming twice the amount of food on each break (10% for each Hostility level).

label: Vanishing Goods
description: Some goods seem to be mysteriously disappearing. Maybe there's a thief in the settlement? Villagers have a higher chance of consuming twice the amount of goods when using services (10% for each Hostility level).

label: Consumerism
description: Villagers have forgotten what a modest life looks like. They want to enjoy life to the fullest. Villagers have a 50% chance to consume double the amount of luxury goods.

label: Parasites
description: One of the villagers was sick, and infected the rest of the settlement with a parasite. All villagers have a 50% chance of eating twice as much during their break.

label: Settler's Luck
description: Villagers have a 35% chance of not consuming food during a break.

label: Mitosis
description: Blood Flowers have a tendency to spread uncontrollably.

label: Master Blueprint
description: A collection of architectural drafts from a very early period in the Citadel's history. Unlocks all advanced camp and fishing hut blueprints, but gathering and fishing speeds are decreased by 50% until you use up at least 300 resource node charges.

label: Survivor Bonding
description: The people in your settlement have survived many hardships, bringing them closer together (+10% villager speed, 1 Global Resolve).

label: Barrel Schematics
description: <sprite name="[vessel] barrels"> Barrels (<sprite name=grade2>) can now be produced in the Lumber Mill and Smithy.

label: Biscuit Recipes
description: <sprite name="[food processed] biscuits"> Biscuits (<sprite name=grade3>) can now be produced in the Kiln and Rain Mill.

label: Blight Filter
description: A crystalline filter designed to mitigate the negative environmental impact of infused rainwater. Blightrot Cysts appear 50% slower when using rain engines, but Reputation from Resolve is generated 90% slower for the next 2 Reputation Points.

label: Blightrot Outbreak
description: The explosion of the machine will not only destroy everything within a 10 field radius, but will also cause 5 Blightrot Cysts to spawn in the settlement.

label: Efficient Brewing
description: +50% to amount of goods produced in the Brewery.

label: Advanced Brewing
description: +60% to amount of goods produced in the Brewery.

label: Rain Pumps
description: Brewery production is 50% quicker.

label: Reckless Plunder
description: Increases the chance of doubling the loot from abandoned caches by 100% (this doesn't apply to perks and blueprints), but newly discovered resource nodes have fewer charges (5 charges to small deposits, 15 charges to large deposits).

label: Cheap Construction
description: All buildings cost 40% less, but every newly discovered resource node has 5 fewer charges.

label: Without Restrictions
description: Villagers have a +10% higher chance of producing double yields, but consumption control is disabled.

label: Copper Extractor
description: Machinery specialized in extracting copper from petrified trees. Gain 1 <sprite name="[metal] copper ore"> Copper Ore for every 5 <sprite name="[mat raw] wood"> Wood produced. All <sprite name="[metal] crystalized dew"> Crystalized Dew production is reduced by 1 (whether from gathering, farming, or production).

label: Worker's Rations
description: All workers have a +10% higher chance of producing double yields, but they also have a +20% higher chance of consuming twice as much food during a break.

label: Rooty Ground
description: Strange roots spread across the land. <sprite name="[mat raw] wood"> Wood production is increased by +1, but harvesting and planting are 25% slower.

label: Haste Makes Waste
description: Scouts work 50% faster on Dangerous Glade Events, but there’s a 50% chance that one of them will die.

label: Wide Nets
description: More durable and much wider nets. Fishing speed is increased by 25%.

label: Termite Infestation
description: +50% to amount of goods produced in the Foragers' Camp and Small Foragers' Camp.

label: Forge Trip Hammer
description: Powerful and precise machinery. <sprite name="[mat processed] parts"> Parts (<sprite name=grade3>) can be produced in the Smithy.

label: Forest Affinity
description: Fox firekeepers have an unusual ability to calm the forest. Hostility from opened glades is lowered by 2 each.

label: Travel Rations
description: With provisions, haulers don't have to return to the Hearth as often. Increases time between breaks for haulers by +50%.

label: Specialized Workwear
description: Specialized equipment enhanced with rainpunk technology. Haulers move +25% faster.

label: Advanced Herbalism
description: +25% to amount of goods produced in the Herb Garden.

label: Advanced Herbalism
description: +50% to amount of goods produced in the Herb Garden.

label: Crowded Houses
description: All houses have room for 1 more villager.

label: Hunter-Gatherers
description: All camp production is increased by 100%, but all buildings that use fertile soil have their yields decreased by 50%. Bonus does not affect the Woodcutters' Camp.

label: Blight Incantation
description: A powerful, necrotic curse. Burning Blightrot Cysts takes 10 more seconds. Hostility is increased by +15 points for every Wildfire Essence stored in the settlement's Warehouse. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Stormbird's Anger
description: Disturbing the Stormbird's nest will instantly summon a storm, which will continue until your scouts have finished working on the event. (Active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on, but canceling the work will not stop the storm)

label: Ancient Ways
description: The ancient Lizard clans are excellent survivalists. They have mastered hunting and foraging like no others. All camps produce a +100% greater yield. This bonus does not affect Woodcutters' Camps. Same building effects do not stack.

label: Carnivorous Tradition
description: Lizard tribes have a long tradition of both animal husbandry and meat preparation. All meat-based complex foods (jerky, skewers, pies, paste) give 2 more Resolve. Same building effects do not stack.

label: Sacrament of the Flame
description: Effect_InstitutionSlowerSacrafice_Description Same building effects do not stack.

label: Ancient Stabilizer
description: A strange relic that fits into the Hearth. Wood production is increased by +2, but the storm will last 40% longer.

label: Fishmen Rituals
description: Heavy clouds are gathering around the Sacrifice Totem. The storm’s duration is increased by +100%, while drizzle and clearance seasons are decreased by –50%.

label: Groundwater Extraction
description: Gain 10 <sprite name="[water] clearance water"> Clearance Water per minute. Increases the tank capacity for every type of rainwater by +50.

label: Metallurgic Proficiency
description: Increases the production speed of Copper Bars, Crystalized Dew, and all recipes that use metal ingots by +33%.

label: Infestation
description: Blightrot becomes extremely aggressive. 8 Blightrot Cysts will spawn in the settlement. Each cyst increases Hostility by +10 points. (Activates every time work on the corresponding Glade Event is started. The effect won't be reversed once work is stopped)

label: Giant Beast
description: Villagers are afraid of going into the woods. All woodcutters and gatherers get a ‑18 penalty to Resolve. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Giant Beast
description: Villagers are afraid of going into the woods. All woodcutters and gatherers get a ‑22 penalty to Resolve. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Giant Beast
description: Villagers are afraid of going into the woods. All woodcutters and gatherers get a ‑16 penalty to Resolve. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Giant Beast
description: Villagers are afraid of going into the woods. All woodcutters and gatherers get a ‑20 penalty to Resolve. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Obelisk
description: Making the right offering at the Obelisk reduces Hostility by ‑10 and increases the Ancient Hearth's resistance by +100.

label: Market Shift Plan
description: Big strategic changes always come with an adjustment period. Every neighboring town offers +2 more trade routes, but no trader will arrive in your settlement until you complete at least 3 trade routes. Traders currently staying in the settlement will leave immediately.

label: Mushroom Seedlings
description: All farms can plant <sprite name="[food raw] mushrooms"> mushrooms (<sprite name=grade2>) on farm fields during drizzle season.

label: Rainpunk Noria
description: A rainpunk waterwheel makes life on farms easier. Planting and harvesting are 30% faster.

label: Overexploitation
description: Global gathering speed is increased by 30%, and newly discovered resource nodes have more charges (+10 charges to small deposits, +25 charges to large deposits). Every 40 node charges used, a Blightrot Cyst will spawn.

label: Overflow
description: The broken machine is pumping rainwater into our tanks at an excessive speed, producing 50 water per minute. However, if the water level in the tanks reaches its maximum capacity, an overcharge will occur every 120 seconds, causing the death of 1 villager.

label: Export Specialization
description: Gain +1 to production yields for all packs of goods.

label: Export Specialization
description: Gain +2 to production yields for all packs of goods.

label: Export Contract
description: Increases the production yield of packs of goods by +50%. Gain 1 additional active trade route slot.

label: Queen's Sailors
description: The storm wasn't gentle, even to a royal-flagged ship. When this effect is active, Hostility is increased by +110, but each ongoing trade route decreases Hostility by ‑40. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Firekeeper's Prayer
description: Glade event work speed increased by 30%. Resources you sacrifice in the Ancient Hearth burn 25% quicker.

label: Generous Rations
description: Global Resolve is increased by 5, but the chance of villagers consuming twice the amount of food during a break is increased by +50%.

label: Royal Guard Training
description: The Crown sends two Royal Guards to your village. Instead of simply brawling, villagers will now train under them. Fulfilling the need for brawling grants an additional +5 to Resolve, but attacking a trader will result in you getting 2 extra Impatience Points.

label: Untapped Wealth
description: Gatherers produce twice the amount of secondary resources when harvesting resource nodes.

label: Regrowth
description: Plants seem to grow exceptionally quickly after the storm. All buildings that use fertile soil produce +50% more goods during the drizzle, and all crops planted during the drizzle will yield +50% more when collected during clearance season.

label: Termite Infestation
description: Harvesting and planting are –50% slower. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Old Ghran's Technique
description: +25% to amount of goods produced in the Small Farm.

label: Farming Tools
description: +50% to amount of goods produced in the Small Farm.

label: Plague of Blindness
description: When they lost their sight, they lost all hope along with it. All villagers move +50% slower and have a +50% chance of destroying a production yield.

label: Plague of Darkness
description: Some say this is the beginning of the end. The storm season is +100% longer, and sacrificing goods at the Ancient Hearth is banned.

label: Plague of Malady
description: The Sealed Ones have inflicted a mysterious disease on the settlement. Villagers take 50% longer rests and have a +100% higher chance of consuming twice as much food during a break.

label: Plague of Mosquitoes
description: The sky turns black with a swarm of mosquitoes. Bitten villagers can't focus on work. Global production speed is 50% slower.

label: Deserted Caravans
description: Global production speed is 33% faster, but traders will arrive 50% slower.

label: Trade Logs
description: Detailed notes on different traders and their wares. Gain 1 additional active trade route slot. Traders will arrive 25% quicker.

label: Ominous Whispers
description: Strange voices can be heard from the sealed vault. All woodcutters and gatherers get a ‑12 penalty to Resolve. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Woodcutter's Prayer
description: If you want to take, you first must give. +1 to <sprite name="[mat raw] wood"> Wood production. Lose all stored fuel upon picking this cornerstone.

label: Sloppy Woodcutting
description: Woodcutting speed is increased by +100%, but fuel consumption in Hearths is increased by 200%.

label: Overgrown Vegetation
description: The flora in this region is bizarrely mutated. Overgrown trees with a lot more resource charges can be found in the forest.

label: Cursed Battlefield
description: The forest has reshaped itself. It is impossible to recognize the danger of the glades, which are now all of even size.

label: Diverse Flora
description: Vegetation here mutates into unique strands. Each type of tree provides distinct bonus resources.

label: Giant Organisms
description: The Marshlands are home to enormous lifeforms. Giant resource nodes can be found in Forbidden Glades (<sprite name="forbidden">). Each glade will have a different one.

label: Buried Mysteries
description: A lush and exotic land, filled with prehistoric remains. Ancient excavation sites can be found here.

label: Beacon Tower
description: A blueprint given to you by the Queen herself. This powerful ancient structure will allow you to summon aid directly from the Citadel.

label: Abyssal Revenge
description: Are those... faces in the trees? Woodcutters don't increase Hostility, but every 10 felled trees add 2 Hostility points. (Hostility scales based on difficulty)

label: Chest of Farming Tools
description: Reward_BeaconEffect_FarmingBoost_Desc

label: Forsaken Altar
description: An ancient altar to the Forsaken Gods. In the midst of the raging storm, you can make sacrifices here to gain unimaginable powers.

label: Blightrot & Corruption
description: Pollution from industrial production feeds the growth of Blightrot Cysts. Deploy Blight Fighters to prevent your Hearths from becoming corrupted during the storm.

label: District (Level 3)
description: The town is booming with activity, and industry thrives. Workers have a 10% higher chance of producing double yields, and global Resolve is increased by 1. The Ancient Hearth's resistance to corruption is increased by 150.

label: Neighborhood (Level 2)
description: Some viceroys say aesthetics don't matter out in the wilds, but you know better than that. Global production speed is increased by 10% and global Resolve is increased by 1. The Ancient Hearth's resistance to corruption is increased by 150.

label: Encampment (Level 1)
description: Gathered around the blazing fire, folks keep each other's spirits high. Global Resolve is increased by 1 and the Ancient Hearth's resistance to corruption is increased by 150.

label: Flooded Mines
description: This region was heavily exploited by other viceroys. Hostility doesn't grow with each passing year, but you’ll gain 2 more Hostility Points per villager. (Hostility scales based on difficulty)

label: Monastery of the Holy Flame
description: The Monks of the Holy Flame are a fanatically egalitarian order. You cannot forbid consumption, or favor any species.

label: Watchtower
description: The Royal Guard is watching over this region. Discovering glades doesn't increase Hostility.

label: Forsaken Gods Temple
description: Due to a strange curse, villagers with low Resolve can't leave the settlement. None of your villagers will generate Reputation from Resolve.

label: Overgrown Library
description: A remnant of a bygone era, when royal archivists themselves ventured out into the wilderness in search of knowledge. One of your starting blueprint choices is replaced by a Wildcard (you can choose one blueprint from all unlocked blueprints).

label: Petrified Necropolis
description: Rocks in this region have a very peculiar shape. And they smell funny... Dead villagers turn to stone. Gain 5 <sprite name="[food raw] meat"> Meat for every 10 Stone and Clay produced.

label: Ruins
description: This region was settled very frequently in the past. The chance of finding ruins in glades is much higher.

label: Advent of Flame
description: A sacred period for all members of the Church. Start with the Temple Blueprint. Impatience grows 4% slower for each person that has their religion need fulfilled.

label: Calm Lands
description: The forest seems to have been soothed. Opening glades no longer increases Hostility.

label: Land Tax
description: Taking advantage of the riches of this new land will cost you. You must pay 2 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber every time you discover a Small Glade, and 6 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber every time you discover a Dangerous (<sprite name="dangerous">) or Forbidden Glade (<sprite name="forbidden">) . Otherwise, 2 villagers will be recalled to the Citadel.

label: Scavenging Party
description: The caravan is prepared for all conditions. Start with all advanced camps unlocked.

label: Third Party
description: The forest is more inviting than usual, but there seems to be something extremely oppressive in this region. Hostility gained by exploring glades reduces by 5, while each year gives an extra 20 Hostility.

label: Wine Shortage
description: The Smoldering City is running low on wine, and demand is soaring. Start with the Cellar Blueprint. The settlement specializes in wine production. Gain +1 to Beaver Resolve for every 70 <sprite name="[needs] wine"> Wine produced.

label: Guild's Sigil
description: A ring given only to the closest friends of the Merchant Guild. Traders will arrive 25% faster, and perks and blueprints will cost 25% less Amber.

label: Fallen Viceroy Commemoration
description: Villagers with their need for species-specific housing met will get an additional +2 to Resolve.

label: Roaming Swarm
description: An angry swarm of giant beasts roams the forest around the settlement, and no messenger dares to cross it. Orders are disabled and traders will arrive 50% slower.

label: Wet Soil
description: It's particularly hard to build anything in this region. Buildings require 50% more materials.

label: Enhanced Blueprints
description: Builders construct buildings 50% faster.

label: Without Restrictions
description: >Missing key<

label: Monastery of the Holy Flame
description: The Monks of the Holy Flame are a fanatically egalitarian order. You cannot forbid consumption, or favor any species.

label: Royal Permit
description: Gain 1 additional cornerstone reroll charge.

label: Royal Permit
description: Our Queen's benevolence knows no bounds. Gain 3 additional cornerstone reroll charges.

label: Awakening
description: Upon awakening the Infected Mole, all dormant cysts activate and start to corrupt the Ancient Hearth. Cysts are vulnerable to Purging Fire when this effect is activated. Completing or canceling the event will not stop the corruption, and cysts will remain active until burned.

label: Heavy Fog
description: The forest is shrouded in a thick miasma, making it impossible to see past the trees (Dangerous and Forbidden Glade warnings disabled). (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Haunted Forest
description: Sometimes, viceroys condemn their people to a terrible fate... Dangerous and Forbidden Glade warnings are disabled.

label: Haunted Forest
description: The forest is shrouded in a thick miasma, making it impossible to see past the trees (Dangerous and Forbidden Glade warnings disabled).

label: Toxic Ooze
description: A toxic substance of unknown origin. Destroys all planted crops in farm fields.

label: Engine Corrosion
description: >Missing key<

label: Engine Corrosion
description: Contaminated liquid gets inside Rain Engines through underground pipes. Using water in Rain Engines generates Blightrot Cysts 50% quicker.

label: Natural Filtration
description: Using Rain Engines causes a lot less Blightrot contamination due to the natural filtration processes of the surrounding vegetation. Blightrot Cysts grow 50% slower when using Rain Engines.

label: Plague of Corrupted Water
description: The rainwater has become contaminated, so rainpunk machinery is now even more hazardous. Using rainwater in rain engines generates Blightrot cysts 100% quicker.

label: Manned Lookout
description: Blight Fighters regularly inspect production buildings. The use of water in Rain Engines generates Blightrot Cysts 10% slower for every Blight Fighter in a building with this upgrade.

label: Earthquake
description: Drainage moles are intelligent beings, but they can be very bad-tempered when hungry. Kills villagers and destroys all resource nodes, buildings, and events within a 20 field radius.

label: Magical Explosion
description: The core of the machinery is unstable, and could explode at any minute. Destroys everything within a 18 field radius.

label: Magical Explosion
description: The core of the machinery is unstable, and could explode at any minute. Destroys everything within a 10 field radius.

label: Discharge
description: The core of the machinery is unstable and will release a small discharge before the main explosion. Destroys deposits and trees, and kills villagers within a 5 field radius.

label: Small Miasma Cloud
description: A thick, spreading cloud of miasma. It kills every living being within a radius of 20 fields.

label: More trade offers
description: Extends available trade offers by 1 in each neighboring town

label: Scientific Award
description: The Queen has decided to reward you for your exceptional achievements in science. You receive an additional cornerstone choice.

label: Effect_PortExtraCornerstone_Name
description: Effect_PortExtraCornerstone_Desc

label: Gift of the Seal Keeper
description: After obtaining a Guardian part, you will be able to choose an Epic Cornerstone offered by the Seal Keeper.

label: Hidden Seal
description: A broken Ancient Seal is hidden somewhere in the forest. To find it, you must first look for clues in the surrounding glades. Its mere presence in this land summons foul plagues upon your settlement during the storm (they are active only during the storm).

label: ModifierEffect_AncientGate_Name
description: ModifierEffect_AncientGate_Desc

label: Ruins
description: This region was settled very frequently in the past. The chance of finding ruins in glades is much higher.

label: Ruins
description: This region was settled very frequently in the past. The chance of finding ruins in glades is much higher.

label: Guild Catalogue
description: Traders will have 1 more perk or blueprint for sale.

label: Scientific Council
description: The Queen has decided to reward you for your exceptional achievements in science. You receive an additional blueprint choice.

label: Budget Cuts
description: The Queen has visited the Obsidian Archives in person, and was dissatisfied with the amount of funding spent on expeditions. You have one fewer initial blueprint.

label: Budget Cuts
description: The Queen has visited the Obsidian Archives in person, and was dissatisfied with the amount of funding spent on expeditions. You have one fewer initial blueprint.

label: Queen's Support
description: This expedition is of special interest to the crown. You gain an extra blueprint choice at the beginning of the game.

label: Flooding
description: Though it may be primitive, Fishmen magic can be very effective. Destroys all roads in the settlement.

label: Wildfire Presence
description: Fuel consumption in Hearths is increased by 150%. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Wildfire Presence
description: Fuel consumption in Hearths is increased by 200%. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Wildfire Presence
description: Fuel consumption in Hearths is increased by 250%. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Wildfire Presence
description: Fuel consumption in Hearths is increased by 300%. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Fickle Flame
description: The miasma is getting closer and closer to the center of the settlement... Fuel consumption in Hearths is increased by 33%.

label: Secret Techniques of the Firekeeper
description: Fuel consumption in Hearths is decreased by 20%.

label: Secret Techniques of the Firekeeper
description: An old manuscript detailing long-forgotten burning rites. Fuel consumption in Hearths is decreased by 25%.

label: Secret Techniques of the Firekeeper
description: An old manuscript detailing long-forgotten burning rites. Fuel consumption in Hearths is decreased by 33%.

label: Pragmatic Frugality
description: Beaver firekeepers know a lot about different burning techniques. Fuel consumption in Hearths is decreased by 20%.

label: Piercing Winds
description: Extremely strong winds make it difficult to sustain the Holy Flame. Fuel consumption in Hearths is increased by 200%.

label: Humid Climate
description: The humidity in this region is unbearable. Fuel consumption in Hearths is increased by 20% for each Hostility level.

label: Guild's Logbook
description: You can see the content of undiscovered glades.

label: Fertile Grounds
description: Glades have an increased chance of including fertile soil.

label: Barren Lands
description: The soil is too acidic. There is no fertile soil anywhere in this region.

label: Light as a Feather
description: Harpy firekeepers can teach villagers how to be more nimble and agile. Global carrying capacity is increased by 5.

label: Market Carts
description: Small wooden carts, perfect for transporting goods. Global carrying capacity is increased by 10. Same building effects do not stack.

label: Public Performances
description: Whether it's theater or martial arts, there's an inspiring show for everyone. The chance of producing double yields is increased by 15%. Same building effects do not stack.

label: Inspiring Pressure
description: The forest is as scary as it is beautiful. Villagers have a 3% higher chance of producing double yields for each Hostility level.

label: District (Level 3)
description: The town is booming with activity, and industry thrives.

label: Prayer
description: A prayer to the Sacred Flame and the Queen herself. Workers have a 5% higher chance of producing double yields. (Granted by one of your viewers)

label: Plague of Blindness
description: When they lost their sight, they lost all hope along with it. All villagers move {1} slower and have a {0} chance of destroying a production yield.

label: Plague of Mosquitoes
description: The sky turns black with a swarm of mosquitoes. Bitten villagers can't focus on work. Global production speed is 50% slower.

label: Good Health
description: Regular baths improve everyone's well-being. Global production rate is 25% faster. Same building effects do not stack.

label: Overheating
description: Global production speed is 33% slower. (the penalty will last until the next storm season)

label: Song of Haste
description: An energetic, inspiring melody. Global production rate is 50% faster for the duration of this season.

label: Sacrifice Oil
description: Global production speed increased by 25%.

label: Neighborhood (Level 2)
description: Even in such a harsh environment, there is still room for beauty.

label: Petrified Egg
description: No Stormbird will ever hatch from this egg, but it's still crackling with energy. Global production speed is 15% faster.

label: Industrialized Agriculture
description: New farming methods are very effective, but cause a lot of pollution. (‑1 to Global Resolve)

label: Small Ancient Artifact
description: A strange device left behind by the Great Civilization. When soaked in rainwater, it radiates warm light and brings encouragement to those around it. (+1 to Global Resolve)

label: Ancient Artifact
description: A strange device left behind by the Great Civilization. When soaked in rainwater, it radiates warm light and brings encouragement to those around it. (+2 to Global Resolve)

label: Explorers' Boredom
description: Who would have thought that great explorers are not so great at planting mushrooms? (‑5 to Global Resolve)

label: Exploration Expedition
description: There’s something truly magical about setting one's foot in a place that’s been hidden for millennia. (+5 to Global Resolve)

description: The ghost from the Forsaken Crypt is threatening the villagers. (‑4 to Global Resolve)

description: Lizard firekeepers are very adept at ancient rites. (+1 to Global Resolve)

label: Harmony
description: When your villagers' needs are met, Harmony is fostered. (+2 to Global Resolve)

label: Gleeman's Tales
description: Every evening, a Gleeman tells stories about past glories, and times before the Great Civil War. (+3 to Global Resolve) Same building effects do not stack.

label: Long Live the Queen
description: Villagers admire the Queen's greatness. (+1 to Global Resolve)

label: Rebellious Spirit
description: The people are feeling oddly rebellious. (+1 to Global Resolve)

label: The Crown Chronicles
description: The people are enjoying living in a prosperous settlement. (+1 to Global Resolve)

description: The people are enjoying living in a prosperous settlement. (+1 to Global Resolve)

label: Converted Totem of Denial
description: A Totem of Denial cleansed by the Holy Flame. Grants a Global Resolve bonus. (+3 to Global Resolve)

label: Creeping Shadows
description: People fear the unknown during the storm. (‑10 to Global Resolve) Timed Resolve effects expire only after the timer reaches 0, even if they were started by a Forest Mystery during the storm.

label: Saturated Air
description: A pleasant, earthy scent is in the air. (+1 to Global Resolve)

label: Stag's Blessing
description: The forest god has blessed your villagers. This day will be remembered for generations. (+1 to Global Resolve)

label: Survivor Bonding
description: The people in your settlement have survived many hardships, bringing them closer together. (+3 to Global Resolve)

label: Vitality

label: Hearth Defect

label: Gift of the Depths

label: Sacrificial Rituals

label: Dye Extractor
description: Gain 5 <sprite name="[crafting] dye"> Dye for every 10 <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects produced.

label: Zhorg's Secret Ingredient

label: Scientific Grant
description: The Queen has decided to reward you for your exceptional achievements in science. Gain 20 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber for every completed stage of an archaeological discovery (excavation, conservation, reconstruction).

label: Stormwalker Tax
description: A joint venture with the Stormwalker Guild can be very profitable. You gain 15 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber every time you accept a newcomer group from the Citadel, but you’ll lose all stored Amber upon choosing this cornerstone.

label: Golden Marrow
description: Some fossils contain valuable surprises. Gain 2 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber for every 20 <sprite name="[crafting] sea marrow"> Sea Marrow produced.

label: Value Added Tax
description: Gain 2 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber for every 6 <sprite name="[packs] pack of trade goods"> Pack of Trade Goods produced.

label: Deep Pockets
description: Receive 10 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber for every 5 completed trade routes.

label: Bed and Breakfast

label: Counterfeit Amber
description: Apparently, there is a technique for extracting crystals similar to Amber from rainwater. Gain 10 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber every time you use 50 units of water in Rain Engines, but traders will have 1 less perk or blueprint for sale.

label: Lumber Tax
description: Gain 1 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber for every 50 <sprite name="[mat raw] wood"> Wood produced.

label: Respected Business Partner
description: Traders value your efforts in keeping the region safe. Amber is worth +10% more for every completed Dangerous and Forbidden Glade Event.

label: Luxury Tax
description: Amber is worth +5% more for every 2 villagers with the need for luxury fulfilled.

label: From the Ashes
description: An odd talisman made from the talons of a phoenix. Gain 2 <sprite name="hearth parts"> Wildfire Essence for every 2 completed Dangerous or Forbidden Glade Events. (except cloned events spawned by fishmen caves and blood flowers)

label: Back to Nature
description: An old, forbidden ritual. Increases yields by 100% in all buildings that use fertile soil. You will lose all stored food (cooked and raw) upon choosing this cornerstone.

label: Vineyard Town
description: The settlement specializes in wine production. Gain +1 to Beaver Resolve for every 70 <sprite name="[needs] wine"> Wine produced.

label: Unbearable Smell
description: Reputation from Resolve is generated 90% slower for the next 2 Reputation Points (source: Blight Filter).

label: Overcharged Rainpunk Technology

label: Overcharged Rainpunk Technology

label: Copper Extractor
description: Machinery specialized in extracting copper from petrified trees. Gain 1 <sprite name="[metal] copper ore"> Copper Ore for every 5 <sprite name="[mat raw] wood"> Wood produced.

label: Leftover Crops
description: Gain 2 <sprite name="[packs] pack of provisions"> Pack of Provisions for every 10 <sprite name="[food raw] herbs"> Herbs produced.

label: Small Distillery
description: The fresh resin still glows softly with the rain's essence. Gain 4 <sprite name="[metal] crystalized dew"> Crystalized Dew for every 20 <sprite name="[mat raw] resin"> Resin produced.

label: Exploration Training
description: Rigorous training has made your scouts exceptionally efficient. For every 5 villagers with the need for brawling fulfilled, the chance of doubling event loot is increased by +20% (this doesn't apply to perks and blueprints).

label: Frightening Visions
description: Horrific phantoms appear before the villagers. Get -3 to Global Resolve every 60 seconds. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Joy Of Discovery
description: Global Resolve is increased by 5 for 180 seconds due to a recently discovered glade (source: Exploration Expedition).

label: Joy Of Discovery
description: Woodcutting speed is decreased by 33% until you discover at least 2 glades (source: Exploration Expedition).

label: Exploration Expedition
description: You took some of the best explorers from the Smoldering City with you. Global Resolve is boosted by +5 for 180 seconds every time a new glade is discovered, but woodcutting is 33% slower until you open at least 2 glades.

label: Forbidden Seal Shard (Stormforged)
description: It was not you who removed this fragment, weakening the ancient seal - but you would still be executed on the spot if someone was to find it in your possession. Every Glade Event solved by making a decision marked as Corruption increases the chance of workers producing double yields by +5%. (the bonus is added retroactively)

label: Ancient Practices
description: Archaeologists have learned a lot about a long-lost culture by examining old ruins. All workers get a +10% higher chance of producing double yields for every 2 completed Dangerous and Forbidden Glade Events. (this bonus is added retroactively and doesn't take cloned events spawned by fishmen caves and blood flowers into account)

label: Family Gratitude
description: Relatives of your villagers send gifts for treating their family members well. Get 40 <sprite name="[vessel] waterskin"> Waterskins for every full Reputation Point obtained through high Resolve.

label: Rain Sorcery

label: Cooking Steam

label: Secure Perimeter
description: Securing the deadliest corners of the forest will make it a lot less terrifying. Completing a Forbidden Glade Event reduces the Hostility gained from Dangerous (<sprite name="dangerous">) and Forbidden Glades (<sprite name="forbidden">) by 2, and from Small Glades by 1. (the bonus is added retroactively)

label: Secure Perimeter
description: Securing the deadliest corners of the forest will make it a lot less terrifying. Every discovered Forbidden Glade lowers the Hostility gained from Dangerous and Forbidden Glades by 2, and from small glades by 1. (the bonus is added retroactively)

label: Friend or Foe
description: The forest is merciless to those who exploit it. To protect itself, it may even sometimes ally with the Blightrot. Every 120 seconds, Blightrot Cysts (1) are spawned for each earned Hostility level. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Borrowed Time
description: The Queen looks more favorably upon a city represented by such distinguished ambassadors. Each fully upgraded house will grant you 10 seconds of Grace Period after the Queen’s Impatience reaches its maximum threshold.

label: Strength in Numbers
description: The storm seems less threatening in a well-populated settlement. Global Resolve drops 2% slower for every Frog villager.

label: City of Wonders
description: Members of the Frog clan flock to your settlement. Gain 1 Frog villager for every 2 house upgrades.

label: Grain Bags
description: Specialized grain farming techniques. <sprite name="[food raw] grain"> Grain production increases by +1 every 25 times it's produced.

label: Growth Medium
description: The Blightrot inside the Rainpunk Cauldron feeds on everything it encounters. For every 20 food produced, 2 Blightrot Cysts are spawned in the settlement. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Tea Specialization
description: The settlement specializes in cosmetic production. Gain +1 to Harpy Resolve for every 70 <sprite name="[needs] tea"> Tea produced.

label: Spices
description: <sprite name="[food raw] herbs"> Herb and <sprite name="[food raw] roots"> Root production is increased by +1 for every 75 <sprite name="[food processed] biscuits"> Biscuits produced.

label: Queen's Sailors
description: The storm wasn't gentle, even to a royal-flagged ship. When this effect is active, Hostility is increased by ‑40, but each ongoing trade route decreases Hostility by 1.

label: Silent Looting
description: Your scouts have learned how to be cautious when looting abandoned caches. Every time you open or send an Abandoned Cache to the Citadel, Hostility is lowered by 15 points.

label: Calming the Forest
description: One who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with all. Every Glade Event solved by making a decision marked as Empathy lowers Hostility by 40. (the bonus is added retroactively)

label: Small Altar Box
description: The forest requires sacrifices. Hostility is reduced by 15 every time 2 villagers die.

label: Cold Flame

label: Lesser Cold Flame
description: A blinding light is aimed directly at the settlement's Hearths, turning the Holy Fire into a cold flame. Hostility is increased by 50 for each Firekeeper in the settlement. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Frequent Patrols
description: Every Glade Event solved by making a decision marked as Loyalty lowers Hostility by 10. (the bonus is added retroactively)

label: Baptism of Fire
description: Every 3 burnt Blightrot Cysts lowers Hostility by 10. While the Hearth is corrupted, you’re unable to sacrifice resources.

label: Protected Trade
description: The forest recedes, as heavily guarded trade caravans pour into the settlement. Hostility is reduced by 15 points every time you sell goods worth 30 Amber, but Complex Food needs grant 1 less Resolve Point.

label: Decryption
description: Archaeologists have learned how to decipher ancient tablets, and can now use that knowledge to appease the angry forest. You get ‑10 Hostility for every <sprite name="[valuable] ancient tablet"> Ancient Tablet in your settlement's Warehouse.

label: Disturbing the Dead
description: Woodcutting angers the dead. Hostility increases by +5 points for every 4 fallen trees. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Disturbing the Dead
description: Woodcutting angers the dead. Hostility increases by +5 points for every 2 fallen trees. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Disturbing the Dead
description: Woodcutting angers the dead. Hostility increases by +5 points for every 5 fallen trees. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Disturbing the Dead
description: Woodcutting angers the dead. Hostility increases by +5 points for every 3 fallen trees. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Calming Water
description: Rainwater seems to soothe the forest. Hostility is reduced by 10 points every time you use 150 units of water in Rain Engines.

label: Blazing Amber
description: Cursed amber crystals burn in our vaults. Hostility increases by +5 for every 30 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber in the settlement's Warehouse.

label: Infestation
description: Blightrot becomes extremely aggressive. 1 Blightrot Cysts will spawn in the settlement. Each cyst increases Hostility by +10 points.

label: Queen's Gift
description: A mysterious amber orb with a magical flame trapped within. Increases the Ancient Hearth's resistance by 150 for every woodcutter in your settlement.

label: Safe Haven
description: Hostility is reduced by 40 for every Hearth upgraded to: Neighborhood (Level 2) (or higher).

label: Generous Gifts
description: Wealthy settlements attract wealthy settlers. Newcomers bring 40% more goods with them for every Hearth level gained.

label: Religious Settlement
description: The settlement specializes in incense production. Gain +1 to Human Resolve for every 70 <sprite name="[needs] incense"> Incense produced.

label: Fragrant Roots
description: Gain 3 <sprite name="[needs] incense"> Incense for every 10 <sprite name="[food raw] roots"> Roots produced.

label: Blight Extractor
description: A curious invention used for extracting Amber from Blightrot Cysts. Every completely infected building (100% Blightrot) generates 3 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber per minute, but also adds +5 Hostility.

label: Woodpecker Technique
description: Gain 2 <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects every time woodcutters cut down a tree during the Storm.

label: Woodpecker Technique
description: Gain 2 <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects every time woodcutters cut down a tree during the Storm.

label: Insect Traps
description: Insect traps let you catch any insects feeding on mushrooms. Gain 1 <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects for every 2 <sprite name="[food raw] mushrooms"> Mushrooms produced.

label: The Crown Chronicles
description: A generation that ignores history has no past and no future. Gain +1 to Global Resolve for every rebuilt or salvaged ruin (the bonus will be added retroactively). Same building effects do not stack.

label: The Guild's Welfare
description: According to custom, a small part of the Amber that goes through each guild should be repaid to support the locals. Gain +1 to Global Resolve every time you sell goods worth 75 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber (the bonus will be added retroactively). Same building effects do not stack.

label: Sacrament of the Flame
description: There can be nothing more sacred than a flame in a world soaked with rain. For every 200 seconds spent sacrificing goods in the Ancient Hearth, Hostility is reduced by 25 (the bonus is added retroactively). Sacrificing multiple resources at the same time will progress this effect's timer faster. Same building effects do not stack.

label: Kelpie's Charm
description: Villagers are under the spell of the Kelpie, controlled like marionettes. Every 90 seconds, 2 random villagers stop working and blindly walk toward the Kelpie where they hallucinate until the effect is gone. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Ancient Pact
description: The cost of knowledge can be very high. You can see the content of undiscovered glades, but discovering Dangerous (<sprite name="dangerous">) or Forbidden Glades (<sprite name="forbidden">) kills 1 villager.

label: Ancient Pact
description: >Missing key<

label: Training Grounds
description: The settlement specializes in training gear production. Gain +1 to Lizard Resolve for every 70 <sprite name="[needs] training gear"> Training Gear produced.

label: Local Taxes
description: Villagers are willing to give you their very last piece of Amber just for a pint of decent ale. Gain 12 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber for every 50 <sprite name="[needs] ale"> Ale produced.

label: Consecrated Scrolls
description: Learning from the consecrated scrolls allows us to better understand the threats we're facing. Every 2 villagers with the need for education fulfilled decreases the forest’s Hostility by ‑10.

label: Firelink Ritual
description: There is nothing the forest hates more than fire. Every villager with their need for religion fulfilled decreases the forest’s Hostility by 5.

label: Lost Supplies
description: An unusual amount of supplies can be found in some glades. Gain 40 <sprite name="[food raw] meat"> Meat and 40 <sprite name="[food raw] grain"> Grain for each completed Dangerous or Forbidden Glade Event. (except cloned events spawned by fishmen caves and blood flowers)

label: Meat Specialization
description: You've managed to enlist some excellent hunters. <sprite name="[food raw] meat"> Meat production increases by +1 every 25 times it's produced.

label: Mist Piercers
description: You are allowed to use the legendary Mist Piercers. With such a rare gift at your disposal, the Queen's expectations are high. The content of glades will be revealed, but each discovered glade increases the Queen’s Impatience by 0.5.

label: Moldy Grain Seeds
description: A new type of grain. Gain 3 <sprite name="[food raw] mushrooms"> Mushrooms for every 10 <sprite name="[food raw] grain"> Grain produced.

label: Adjustment Period
description: No trader will arrive in your settlement until you complete at least 3 trade routes. Traders currently staying in the settlement will leave immediately (source: Market Shift Plan).

label: Fungal Guide
description: Ancient mushroom farming techniques are described within. <sprite name="[food raw] mushrooms"> Mushroom production increases by +1 every 25 times it's produced.

label: Economic Migration
description: Rumor has it that your settlement is one of the wealthiest in the realm. Newcomers will arrive 15% quicker and bring 10% more goods for every 1 level of standing you have with other settlements on trade routes. (the bonus is added retroactively)

label: The Night's Embrace
description: The settlement is slowly engulfed in darkness. Each Blightrot Cyst increases Hostility by +5 points during the storm.

label: Overflow
description: The machine is somehow connected with the settlement's underground pipe system. You lose 4 units of a random type of rainwater every 10 seconds. Every 120 seconds, 2 Blightrot Cysts are spawned in the settlement.

label: Overflow
description: The machine is somehow connected with the settlement's underground pipe system. You lose 4 units of a random type of rainwater every 6 seconds. Every 120 seconds, 2 Blightrot Cysts are spawned in the settlement.

label: Overflow
description: The machine is somehow connected with the settlement's underground pipe system. You lose 4 units of a random type of rainwater every 12 seconds. Every 120 seconds, 2 Blightrot Cysts are spawned in the settlement. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Overflow
description: The machine is somehow connected with the settlement's underground pipe system. You lose 4 units of a random type of rainwater every 8 seconds. Every 120 seconds, 2 Blightrot Cysts are spawned in the settlement.

label: Free Samples
description: Gain 1 <sprite name="[mat processed] parts"> Parts every time you sell goods worth 25 Amber.

label: Filling Dish
description: <sprite name="[food processed] porridge"> Porridge production increases by +1 for every 150 units of <sprite name="[water] drizzle water"> Drizzle Water produced.

label: Archaeological Tools
description: Glades are examined more carefully. Gain 20 <sprite name="[vessel] pottery"> Pottery every time you discover a new glade.

label: Prayers
description: Impatience grows 4% slower for each person that has their religion need fulfilled.

label: Work Safety Guide
description: A standardized set of rules. Every villager with their need for education fulfilled increases global production speed by 5%.

label: Gathering Tools
description: Vital equipment when exploring the wilds. Gain 6 <sprite name="[packs] pack of provisions"> Pack of Provisions every time you discover a new glade.

label: Seized Inheritance
description: The property of the deceased is seized for the benefit of the whole settlement. Gain 20 random goods every time a villager dies.

label: Trade Hub
description: The settlement is known for being a major trade hub in the region. Gain 1 Reputation Point every time you sell goods worth 60 Amber, but fulfilling Orders awards 50% less Reputation.

label: Ale and Hearty
description: Reputation generated through high Resolve grows +20% faster for every 2 villagers with the need for leisure fulfilled.

label: Prosperous Archaeology
description: The people are invigorated by every discovered cache. Every time you open or send 2 Abandoned Caches to the Citadel, you gain +1 to Global Resolve.

label: Vitality
description: A rich diet is beneficial for your villagers' health. Gain +1 to Global Resolve for every 200 times any complex food need is fulfilled (the bonus is added retroactively). Same building effects do not stack.

label: Inspiring Work
description: Global Resolve is increased by 3 for 120 seconds due to recently felled trees (source: Woodcutter's Song).

label: Woodcutter's Song
description: It's off to work we go. For every 20 felled trees, Global Resolve is increased by 3 for 120 seconds.

label: Rebellious Spirit
description: The people are feeling oddly rebellious. Gain +1 Global Resolve for every 2 Impatience Points. Every time a villager leaves or dies, Impatience is increased by an additional 0.2 points.

label: Long Live the Queen
description: Villagers tell stories of the Queen's unparalleled power. Global Resolve grows by 1 for every 3 Reputation Points gained. (the bonus is added retroactively)

label: Prosperous Settlement
description: Gain +1 to Global Resolve every time you sell goods worth 50 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber, but scouts work 10% slower on Glade Events.

description: The Crown is very forgiving - as long as the goods keep flowing. Impatience grows 30% slower for 180 seconds every time you finish a trade route.

label: Robbed Dead

label: Robbed Dead
description: The scent of your wealth makes the robbed spirit angry. You get -6 to Global Resolve for every 10 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber in the settlement's Warehouses. (Is active only when the corresponding Glade Event is being worked on)

label: Royal Funding
description: The Queen's generosity knows no limits. Gain 2 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber every time you sell goods worth 10 Amber.

label: Golden Dust

label: Shadowy Figure
description: Global Resolve is decreased by -10 for 180 seconds due to a recently discovered glade (source: Creeping Shadows).

description: Discovering a glade during the storm will decrease Global Resolve by -10 for 3 minutes.

label: Cricket Mating Grounds
description: The clearings are abuzz with the sound of crickets. Gain 30 <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects for each discovered glade.

label: Spreading Contamination
description: Blightrot contaminates everything you send to the Citadel. During the storm, the Queen's Impatience grows 5% faster for every Blightrot Cyst in your settlement.

label: Greater Threat
description: During the storm, receive -2 to Global Resolve for every Dangerous (<sprite name="dangerous">) and Forbidden Glade (<sprite name="forbidden">) discovered since the beginning of the settlement. (the penalty is added retroactively)

label: Blightrot Infection
description: Villagers report feeling sick, especially during the storm. When a villager leaves or dies, 2 Blightrot Cysts will appear in the settlement.

label: Forgiving Crown
description: Gain one free cornerstone reroll for every Reputation Point gained during drizzle season.

label: Gentle Dawn
description: New year, new challenges. Every small glade discovered grants +10% to planting speed during Drizzle. (the bonus is added retroactively)

label: Forest Offerings
description: It seems some inhabitants of the forest are grateful for your efforts. During drizzle season, every Dangerous or Forbidden Glade Event you complete will give you 40 random raw food.

label: Rotten Rain

label: Marrow Growth

label: Vanishing Water
description: Infused rainwater slowly evaporates. You lose 1 unit of a random type of water for every 2 units of water used in Rain Engines.

label: Bleeding Trees
description: A red, sticky substance is oozing out from beneath the tree bark. Gain 2 <sprite name="[mat raw] resin"> Resin every time woodcutters cut down a tree.

label: Saturated Air
description: A pleasant, earthy scent is in the air. Gain +1 to Global Resolve for every 30 units of water used in Rain Engines.

label: Resisting Flora
description: The trees seem to come to life during the storm... Woodcutting is –90% slower, but each fallen tree gives 5 <sprite name="[food raw] meat"> Meat.

label: Aura of Peace
description: After each storm comes a time of peace and regrowth. Gain 0.5 Reputation Points for every Dangerous or Forbidden Glade Event completed during drizzle season.

label: Finders Keepers
description: After each storm, caravans find countless goods scattered along their routes. Every trade route you complete during drizzle season will give you 5 random packs of goods.

label: Soaked Clothes
description: Global Resolve is decreased by -6 for 120 seconds due to a missed payment (source: Cloudburst).

label: Thunder
description: A terrifying sound from a raging sky. Every 50 seconds, 3 buildings are destroyed by lightning.

label: Sunken Bones
description: Thorough research has shown that marine remains can be found near copper veins in this land. Gain 10 <sprite name="[crafting] sea marrow"> Sea Marrow for every 10 <sprite name="[metal] copper ore"> Copper Ore produced.

label: Hidden Mystery
description: Scouts from the royal guard have been called to search glades for traces of Sealed Spiders. Gain 1 <sprite name="[valuable] ancient tablet"> Ancient Tablet for every 2 discovered glades. (the bonus is added retroactively)

label: Force of Nature
description: The forest and the everlasting rain are connected somehow. Gain +3 to Storm Water production for every 2 Woodcutters in your settlement. Increases the tank capacity for every type of rainwater by +50 (one time only).

label: Stormbird's Cry
description: An angry stormbird mother is following your caravan. Gain -2 to Global Resolve during the storm.

label: Hidden Reward
description: Gain 1 <sprite name="[valuable] ancient tablet"> Ancient Tablet for every 2 completed Glade Events. (the bonus is added retroactively)

label: Plague of Death
description: The Sealed Ones are thirsty for blood. Discover 2 Dangerous (<sprite name="dangerous">) or Forbidden Glades (<sprite name="forbidden">) during this storm. If you don't, 3 villagers will be killed in the coming drizzle season.

label: Bone Tools
description: Gain 3 <sprite name="[tools] simple tools"> Tools every time a villager leaves or dies.

label: Improvised Tools
description: Woodcutters are tasked with creating makeshift tools. Discovering a glade during the Storm grants 10 <sprite name="[tools] simple tools"> Tools.

label: Forbidden Tools
description: All metal is permeated with malevolent magic from the forest. Every 2 Hostility levels grant +1 to <sprite name="[tools] simple tools"> Tools production.

label: Full Stock
description: A Warehouse full of provisions makes it easier to prepare your caravans. Trade routes are faster by 5% for every 10 <sprite name="[packs] pack of provisions"> Pack of Provisions in your settlement's Warehouses.

label: Urban Planning
description: For every 10 completed trade routes, all houses will have room for one more person.

label: Lost in the Wilds
description: Gain one villager every time you discover a new glade.

label: Voice of the Forest
description: Trees communicate with each other through their roots, making the forest aware of your every move. Spawns 1 Blightrot Cysts every 120 seconds for every 2 Dangerous (<sprite name="dangerous">) or Forbidden Glade (<sprite name="forbidden">) discovered. (the penalty is added retroactively)

label: Book of Water

description: Reward_WaterskinsForLeather_Desc

label: Scientific Agreement

label: No Quality Control
